message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about the effects of solar energy on temperature. When an object, such as ice cream, absorbs solar energy from the sun, it causes the temperature of the object to increase. This is because the absorbed energy is converted into heat energy. Therefore, the correct answer is (A) go up. Option (B) is incorrect because ice cream does not explode when exposed to solar energy. Option (C) is incorrect because solar energy does have an effect on temperature. Option (D) is incorrect because the temperature would not decrease when the ice cream absorbs solar energy.

This question requires basic knowledge about the effect of solar energy on temperature. When ice cream is left outside and exposed to the sun, it will absorb the solar energy, causing the temperature of the ice cream to increase. Option (B) is incorrect because ice cream will not explode when exposed to the sun. Option (C) is incorrect because the absorption of solar energy will cause a change in temperature. Option (D) is incorrect because the temperature of the ice cream will increase, not decrease.

This question involves an understanding of how thermal energy works and the effect of sunlight on temperature. When an object, such as ice cream, is exposed to sunlight, it absorbs the solar energy. This energy is then converted into thermal energy, which causes the temperature of the object to increase. Therefore, leaving ice cream outside in the sun will cause the temperature of the ice cream to go up. Option (B) is incorrect because ice cream does not explode when exposed to sunlight. Option (C) is incorrect because the absorption of solar energy will have an effect on the temperature of the ice cream. Option (D) is incorrect because the thermal energy from the sun will cause the temperature of the ice cream to increase, not decrease.
